title: Product Videographer and Photographer - Phoenix, AZ
description:

We are a dynamic company specializing in garage door hardware and garage storage solutions. Our products are designed to maximize space and efficiency in your garage, and we take pride in our cutting-edge manufacturing processes. We are looking for a talented videographer for an exciting two-part video and photo shoot help us capture our new product line as well as our new manufacturing and distribution facility.

Responsibilities:
Part 1: Product Photo and Video Shoot

Capture professional-grade video and photography of our overhead garage storage system.
Document the product assembly process and showcase its usage in a garage setting.
Ensure all shots highlight the product's features and benefits effectively.

Part 2: Facility Video Shoot

Shoot a comprehensive video tour of our warehouse and manufacturing plant (drone footage preferred).
Highlight key aspects of our facility, including machinery, production lines, and overall operations.
Create engaging content that showcases our company's capabilities and industry standards.

Skills:
Proven experience as a videographer with a strong portfolio of relevant work.
Proficiency in video and photo editing software.
Ability to work with various types of equipment and lighting setups.
Strong attention to detail and creative vision.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
Ability to meet deadlines and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

This project will consist of 3-4 days of video and photo shooting in 2 different locations near Phoenix, AZ as well as post production video editing.

title: Podcast Video Intro Editor
description:
We are looking for a skilled video editor to create engaging and professional intros for our podcast episodes. The style and quality we’re aiming for are similar to those used by Jay Shetty in his podcast "On Purpose." Here’s what we’re looking for:

Key Elements
Visuals and Aesthetics:

Clean and Minimalist Design: The intros should feature a clean, minimalist design that is visually appealing but not overwhelming. Subtle animations or transitions should add a professional touch, keeping the focus on clarity and elegance.
High-Quality Imagery: Use high-resolution visuals that align with the podcast’s theme. The color scheme should be calm and inviting, creating a warm and engaging atmosphere.
Text and Typography:

Bold and Readable Fonts: Text should be bold, easy to read, and aligned centrally to draw attention. Typography should be modern and clean, with key information like episode titles or guest names prominently displayed.
Subtle Text Animations: Incorporate smooth and subtle animations for text as it enters and exits the screen, enhancing professionalism without distracting from the content.
B-roll Usage:

Contextual Visuals: Select B-roll footage that complements the episode’s theme, such as scenic shots, abstract visuals, or relevant clips that add depth to the narrative. The B-roll should enhance the storytelling rather than just serve as filler.
Smooth Integration: Ensure that the B-roll transitions smoothly with the primary footage, maintaining a coherent visual flow that keeps the audience engaged.
Pacing and Timing:

Concise and Engaging: The intro should be brief—typically between 10-15 seconds—quickly engaging the viewer and transitioning smoothly into the main content. It should be punchy and effective at grabbing attention without overstaying its welcome.
Strategic Use of Music: Background music should be carefully chosen to match the tone of the episode—calm, inspirational, and uplifting. The music should complement the dialogue rather than overpower it.
Sound Design:

Atmospheric Music: Use background music that is aligned with the episode's tone, creating an uplifting and reflective mood. The audio mix should ensure that music enhances the narrative without overshadowing it.
Layered Sound Effects: Subtle sound effects should be layered over the visuals to enhance the immersive experience. These effects should emphasize certain points or transitions within the intro, contributing to a polished and professional sound design.
Narration and Voiceover:

Personalized Voiceovers: If applicable, include a brief voiceover to summarize the episode’s theme or introduce the guest. The voiceover should be conversational and relatable, helping to establish a connection with the audience right from the start.
Requirements:

Experience in creating high-quality video intros, particularly in the style of Jay Shetty’s podcast.
Proficiency in video editing software like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar tools.
Creativity and attention to detail to deliver polished, professional content.
How to Apply:
Please submit your portfolio or examples of similar work, along with a brief explanation of how you would approach creating an intro for 'It's Up There Podcast.' For reference, you can check out this video by Jay Shetty: Jay Shetty Video Intro Example. Please also provide any additional public links to similar work if available.

title: Liquid Sim VFX Shot Creator
description:
We are looking for a skilled VFX artist who can create a realistic liquid simulation shot for a video project. The shot will showcase a cut from two onscreen talent into an explosion of paint elements that appear to blast from that center point onto an existing practical set in a visually striking and dynamic way. The VFX artist will be responsible for creating the simulation and rendering the shot.
  
Relevant skills:
  - Proficiency in creating liquid simulations using software such as Houdini or RealFlow
  - Strong understanding of physics and fluid dynamics
  - Ability to create realistic shaders and textures for the liquid element
  - Experience in compositing and color grading to ensure seamless integration
  - Attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work on time.

Our studio is located in Burbank, CA with the expectation that the artist will come onsite the afternoon of 8/16 to complete any scans and prep work to accomplish the shot. 

This is a small-sized project that can be completed in a relatively short duration. We expect the job to be completed within 2 weeks from practical filming date (8/16). We are seeking an expert VFX artist with prior experience in creating liquid simulations for professional video productions. 

If you are passionate about VFX, have a strong portfolio showcasing your previous work in liquid simulations, and can bring our vision to life, we would love to hear from you!
